data.title: Strange method implementation for MathHelper.LerpPrecise
Could not load file or assembly ‘MonoMac’ or one of its dependencies Mac OS X
data.body:
Hello, I am attempting to follow along the Games from Scratch tutorial1, basically I have installed the universal Mono dev kit 4.2.1.102, Monogame 3.4, and Xamarin studio 5.10 on OSX 10.11.1, but when I try to run the basic Xamarin.Mac Monogame template I get the following in "Application Output":

[http://hastebin.com/raw/ugopifidug](http://hastebin.com/raw/ugopifidug)

Basically its "Could not load file or assembly 'MonoMac.'

I have attempted editing my references, and I have tried adding a MonoMac assembly (which is suspiciously version 0.0.0.0), but when I do that I get several errors stating that many of the definitions are already defined, making me believe this is a naming issue.

I have tried uninstalling Mono, Xamarin Studio, and Monogame, and reinstalling them, but that did not help.

Any help is greatly appreciated!

data.title: (Mac) Changing any GraphicsDeviceManager settings and calling ApplyChanges results in silent crash
Texture2D.GetData buggy for DXT textures
[Mac] Upgrade to the newer Xamarin.Mac API
data.body:
The newer Xamarin Mac API changes the namespace for all of the Mac APIs (they are no longer prefixed with `MonoMac`).  This is the unified API that is shared with iOS and tvOS.  Xamarin have since deprecated the legacy API, so I think it's safe to say that the legacy API might not work on newer versions of OS X (especially through the App Store).

The newest version of Protobuild targets this unified API by default, but MonoGame still targets the old API.

This page has more details on the Unified API for Mac: https://developer.xamarin.com/guides/cross-platform/macios/updating_mac_apps/

data.title: Add automated.build so I can track MonoGame upstream on my build server
data.body:
I expect this not to initially work for all of the platforms, but I'm submitting the PR so it runs on the MG build server.

This uses the new automated build script functionality in Protobuild to generate and build for all relevant platforms.  It simplifies the `default.build` script greatly, and removes a bunch of conditional logic that is no longer necessary.

I'd like to get the `automated.build` script also running the tests, but since these run through NUnit and make use of a NAnt script, I don't want to do that until I know whether or not it'll impact the reporting of tests in TeamCity.

(I also removed the old GenerateProject / GenerateSolution files since they're no longer needed with WindowsUniversal and tvOS being merged into Protobuild).

data.title: Fixed index check for gamepad
data.body:
Thanks @Helikin for pointing it out.
#4083

data.title: [Pipeline] Add FilterOutput view
data.body:
Add a Filtered output view similar to https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/pull/4168.

There are few hacks to hide the Header from the TabControl and also to scroll the treeview without flickering.

One difference from GTK version is that 'Cleaning' show short paths relative to project Output Directory.

Another is that I didn't merge the two views under one control , everything in Winforms is public and visible from MainForm, the original _outputView had already too many references and not sure the best way to do this in WinForms.

data.title: [MGCB] Inconsistent output when two files in a row have errors
data.body:
![mgcberror](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3018589/11445114/491418a4-9532-11e5-9f0c-caa09723a423.png)

The .mgcb file have 3 files, GeometryA , GeometryB , GeometryC. Files B & C are corrupted.
Notice that between the error messages for B and C, a line is missing with the filename of C.
"P:/TestPipeline/GeometryC.fbx"

As a result, tools like  https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/pull/4168 might group all error lines under the file 'GeometryB.fbx'. 

Actually the GTK tool might be immune to it as it checks for lines starting with '/', haven't tested it since I haven't got a Linux box. But on windows where paths start with a letter I am trying different tricks, like File.Exists(line) as a hint to restart.

data.title: Problems with a DirectX shader ported to OpenGL
data.body:
Hi there, I've got a problem with a shader that is working fine with DirectX but that's causing MonoGame to throw the following exception with the OpenGL version:

```
System.ArgumentException: Offset and length were out of bounds for the array or count is greater than the number of elements from index to the end of the source collection.
  at System.Buffer.BlockCopy (System.Array src, Int32 srcOffset, System.Array dst, Int32 dstOffset, Int32 count) [0x000a7] in /private/tmp/source-mono-mac-4.2.0-branch/bockbuild-mono-4.2.0-branch/profiles/mono-mac-xamarin/build-root/mono-4.2.1/mcs/class/corlib/ReferenceSources/Buffer.cs:61
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.ConstantBuffer.SetData (Int32 offset, Int32 rows, Int32 columns, System.Object data) [0x00054] in <filename unknown>:0
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.ConstantBuffer.SetParameter (Int32 offset, Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.EffectParameter param) [0x000a0] in <filename unknown>:0
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.ConstantBuffer.Update (Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.EffectParameterCollection parameters) [0x00056] in <filename unknown>:0
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.EffectPass.Apply () [0x00094] in <filename unknown>:0
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SpriteBatcher.FlushVertexArray (Int32 start, Int32 end, Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.Effect effect, Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.Texture texture) [0x00032] in <filename unknown>:0
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SpriteBatcher.DrawBatch (SpriteSortMode sortMode, Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.Effect effect) [0x001dd] in <filename unknown>:0
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.SpriteBatch.End () [0x00019] in <filename unknown>:0
  at MacTester.ParallaxPostProcessor.process () [0x000ce] in /Users/tanis/Documents/Nez-MonoGame/MacTester/ParallaxPostProcessor.cs:45
  at Nez.Scene.postRender () [0x0003b] in /Users/tanis/Documents/Nez-MonoGame/Nez-PCL/ECS/Scene.cs:115
  at Nez.Core.Draw (Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GameTime gameTime) [0x00048] in /Users/tanis/Documents/Nez-MonoGame/Nez-PCL/Core.cs:142
  at MacTester.Game1.Draw (Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GameTime gameTime) [0x00003] in /Users/tanis/Documents/Nez-MonoGame/MacTester/Game1.cs:109
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game.DoDraw (Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GameTime gameTime) [0x00022] in <filename unknown>:0
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game.Tick () [0x00221] in <filename unknown>:0
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GameWindow.OnRenderFrame (MonoMac.OpenGL.FrameEventArgs e) [0x0003f] in <filename unknown>:0
  at MonoMac.OpenGL.MonoMacGameView.RenderScene () [0x000e7] in <filename unknown>:0
  at MonoMac.OpenGL.MonoMacGameView.<StartAnimation>m__1 () [0x00001] in <filename unknown>:0
  at MonoMac.Foundation.NSActionDispatcher.Apply () [0x00001] in <filename unknown>:0
  at at (wrapper dynamic-method) System.Object:[MonoMac.Foundation.NSActionDispatcher:Void Apply()] (MonoMac.Foundation.NSObject,MonoMac.ObjCRuntime.Selector)
  at at (wrapper native-to-managed) System.Object:[MonoMac.Foundation.NSActionDispatcher:Void Apply()] (MonoMac.Foundation.NSObject,MonoMac.ObjCRuntime.Selector)
  at at (wrapper managed-to-native) MonoMac.AppKit.NSApplication:NSApplicationMain (int,string[])
  at MonoMac.AppKit.NSApplication.Main (System.String[] args) [0x0003d] in <filename unknown>:0
  at MacTester.Program.Main (System.String[] args) [0x0001d] in /Users/tanis/Documents/Nez-MonoGame/MacTester/Main.cs:26
```

Here's the source of the DirectX shader: https://gist.github.com/tanis2000/037cd70fb2edfac1ffb1
And here's the OpenGL one: https://gist.github.com/tanis2000/03e5e544aa4e32b5abd1
This is the class that I use to load and run it: https://gist.github.com/tanis2000/3c4ccadf21187c6df1fe

I don't know if I made an error when porting it to OpenGL or if there's something else that should be done to get it running correctly with MonoGame and OpenGL.
Thanks for all the help! Cheers!

data.title: Implements integer array EffectParameter setting.
data.body: Implements EffectParameter.SetValue() for int[] objects.

data.title: Investigating an "app can't start" issue
data.body:
Hello there,

We are getting reports of several players that our game doesn't work anymore. The process starts, but is stuck at 72KB memory usage and 0% CPU. It doesn't crash and stays like that. No window, nor icon appear, which make me think that the program fails before the Main().

The only relevant change we made before getting those reports was to update MonoGame to the latest source code. Before that, we were on commit 4d5a7fd, from the 29th September (https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/tree/4d5a7fd8c0971f2fec4e52f40b06f2289874a42c). I've reviewed merged commits since then and couldn't identify a potential cause.

Given that the process gets stuck at 72KB, it most probably is a problem with the .NET bootstrap (and would appear to not even call the Main()), so it may not be related to MonoGame. But builds prior to the update are still working.

Players' environments seem fine, the game was working previously, hence they meet software requirements.

I couldn't reproduce the issue on any of our machines.

Does anybody already ran into this kind of problem with a .Net app? My best guess would be that .Net is unable to load some assemblies, but it would result in a crash, isn't it?

P.S.: it's a Windows DX project. Also, I've verified all assemblies for corruption, everything is fine. I'm also signing everything, so I don't think it's a problem with GAC and local assemblies.

data.title: [Gtk Pipeline] Save preferences between restarts
data.body:
Stuff that gets saved:
- windows size
- window maximized
- horizontal and vertical separator positions
- filter output toggle
- debug mode toggle

Notes:
- I didn't save window position since the operating system itself handles that better, ie. multimonitor
- I used XmlSerialization
- Gtk already contained "Settings" so I named our settings "PipelineSettings"

data.title: SpriteFont.MeasureString(text) gives incorrect height
data.body:
Hey,

I've found bug with method MeasureString(text). I try to set text into center of rectangle but with some fonts it will be never centred, because MeasureString() gives incorrect height. Bug noticed with many fonts, for example
- Comix Loud - http://www.dafont.com/comix-loud.font
- Luckiest Guy - http://www.1001freefonts.com/luckiest_guy.font

Verified with stable 3.4 release and newest server build #3.5.0.826. Please take a look on attached screenshot.
![measurestringissue](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16008535/11385338/0fc68c38-9318-11e5-9c78-8d3bb3f46088.png)

data.title: Rectangle XmlSerialization
data.body:
Serializing a rectangle gives:

``` xml
<Rectangle>
    <X>0</X>
    <Y>0</Y>
    <Width>0</Width>
    <Height>0</Height>
    <Location>
      <X>0</X>
      <Y>0</Y>
    </Location>
    <Size>
      <X>0</X>
      <Y>0</Y>
    </Size>
  </Rectangle>
```

so... did Xna also write out Size and Location? They seem kind of pointless especially considering they are calculated.

data.title: libmojoshader_64.dll not found
data.body:
When i try to compile effects with monogame pipeline 3.4, it stops with the error saying libmojoshader_64.dll not found. I tried with 2mgfx tool but the result is same. however the version 3.3 works fine. but i cannot use xnb files from 3.3 with my project which uses monogame 3.4.

I tried compiling from source. but i cannot find all the dependancies.

data.title: Android game black screen / full color screen on Galaxy S6 (64-bit, arm64-v8a)
data.body:
When launching my android game (Kontur on Google Play) on a 64-bit phone, the game will get a black screen, which will turn into green. The music will still play, but the rendering will just render a black or green screen.
This is a problem exclusive to 64-bit. I have the latest version of Xamarin. I have enabled support for all architectures.
I do not have a 64-bit phone myself so I can't debug it unfortunately, but my game artist (in another city unfortunately) has reported this error.

data.title: HLSL/Directx11 Unable to pass sampler2d texture to the pixel shader.
[Pipeline] Remove default VertexColor Channel
data.body:
MGCB always add an extra color vertex channel to Models.
XNA 4.0 pipeline never did that with Models, at least on the two platforms I tested it with (Windows/Phone).

data.title: Fixed Icon crash
data.body:
It seems that Mono's System.Drawing can't load embedded resources correctly when the dll file is compiled with .Net.

The crash was:

```
System.ArgumentException: The argument 'stream' must be a picture that can be used as a Icon
Parameter name: stream
  at System.Drawing.Icon.InitFromStreamWithSize (System.IO.Stream stream, Int32 width, Int32 height) [0x00013] in /builddir/build/BUILD/mono-4.2.1/mcs/class/System.Drawing/System.Drawing/Icon.cs:685

  at System.Drawing.Icon..ctor (System.IO.Stream stream) [0x00000] in /builddir/build/BUILD/mono-4.2.1/mcs/class/System.Drawing/System.Drawing/Icon.cs:212
  at at (wrapper remoting-invoke-with-check) System.Drawing.Icon:.ctor (System.IO.Stream)
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.OpenTKGameWindow.Initialize (Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game game) [0x00102] in <filename unknown>:0
```

data.title: [MGCB] Write averageBytesPerSecond and blockAlign for SoundEffect
data.body:
Get averageBytesPerSecond from bitRate (=bitsPerSecond) and calculate
blockAlign for PCM format.

With this fix SoundEffect XNBs can be used again from XNA. The move to
ffmpeg (https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/pull/3197) broke backward compatibility.

data.title: Fixed ContentManager
data.body: In #3863 I set 'w' instead of 'g', 'w' is WindowsDX, 'g' is WindowsGL.

data.title: [WindowsGL] multiple gamepad issues
data.body:
Hi, it seems that there are some issues with the GamePad class on WindowsGL:
- Even though the method IsConnected() returns true, all buttons and all tumbsticks are on their default state (ButtonState.Released & Vector2.Zero).
- If I unplug the pad then restart the game, the buttons and thumbsticks work well
- But the Dpad is still not recognized (all the Dpad buttons are set to ButtonState.Released)
- The Y axis of the thumbsticks points down instead of up
- The PacketNumber always returns 0

I have observed those issues on 2 different PCs (both on Windows 7) with 2 different classic XBox 360 controllers. Also those issues do not occur in a Windows DirectX project.

edit: forgot to mention that it was tested with Monogame 3.5.0.730.

data.title: Remove DisplayMode.RefreshRate (to match XNA)
data.body:
Resolves #4221

`DisplayMode.RefreshRate` was removed in XNA 4 (Shawn Hargeaves explains some of the reasons why this was removed [here](http://xboxforums.create.msdn.com/forums/p/70732/432151.aspx#432151)). This PR removes this property from MonoGame to match XNA.

data.title: Fix XNA test regressions
data.body:
The XNA test project was broken by a couple recent(-ish) PRs.
- As part of #4098 the 3D cube components were updated to use a `DrawIndexedPrimitives` overload that does not exist in XNA. Reverted the calls back to the old overload, which internally uses the new code.
- Also as part of #4098 a test for the new overload was added. Added `#if !XNA` around the test.
- The test for `MathHelper.LerpPrecise` function introduced in #4233 was included in the XNA project too. Added `#if !XNA` around the test.

As a disclaimer, I only have the XNA redist installed at the moment, so I had to exclude the Content Pipeline tests from compilation on my machine. Therefore I cannot guarantee that the project is completely buildable even with these changes, and this must be given a full test before merging.

I assume that #3550 is dead? Besides, how important are these compatibility tests anymore, as they can be broken for months and XNA has been long dead? We have a few missing features to implement and some edge cases for which crosstesting will be useful, but otherwise these seem to be neglected.
